recipe.title: How to Make Okonomiyaki
recipe.intro: Okonomiyaki is a Japanese savory pancake. It has cabbage, meat, and a tasty sauce on top.
recipe.ingredients: flour, egg, water, cabbage, pork belly slices, okonomiyaki sauce, mayonnaise, bonito flakes, vegetable oil
steps: **Mix** flour, egg, and water in a big bowl to make the batter.
**Cut** the cabbage into thin pieces and add it to the batter.
**Heat** oil in a pan on medium heat.
**Pour** the batter into the pan and make a round shape.
**Put** pork slices on top and cook for four minutes. Then turn it over.
**Cook** for four more minutes and put sauce, mayonnaise, and bonito flakes on top. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I visited Pink Blossom Terrace last weekend. It was a small restaurant near Balmoral Beach. The terrace had pink flowers and white chairs. I could see the calm blue sea from my table. I ordered okonomiyaki and green tea. The pancake was hot and crispy. The sauce and mayonnaise were perfect together. It was a beautiful and peaceful place. I took many photos.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Jack, tonight we will make okonomiyaki. It is a Japanese pancake.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: No, it is not sweet. It is savory. It has cabbage and pork inside.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Oh, interesting! What do I do first?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: First, cut the cabbage into thin pieces.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Like this? Is this thin enough?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Yes, that is good! Now mix it with the batter.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: OK. Can I cook it in the pan?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Sure! Make a round shape. Put pork on top.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: When do I turn it over?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: After four minutes. Be careful, it is heavy.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: I did it! It looks great!

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Now put sauce and mayonnaise on top.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: This is so much fun. And it smells amazing!
